Avoid using the cream for a few days, and when you see the redness has become a bit better, then start using it. It will help get rid of those stubborn marks caused by sunburn.Do not use the ointment without a doctor's consultation if you have very sensitive skin. In case you are a breastfeeding mother, then you must consult the doctor before using the ointment because it can pass on to the baby in small amounts through breast milk. Pregnant women should also consult the doctor before using it.Do not go into the direct sunlight while using this ointment because it makes your skin sensitive to the sunlight and may cause blisters on the skin. Keep the ointment away from children’s reach.Store it at room temperature.Do not use the expired ointment.Tell your doctor/Pharmacist your medical history of, Asthma, Open sores or broken areas of skin (especially on the face or hands), other skin conditions (e.g., Eczema, Psoriasis).

precautions: Some of the precautions that should be followed while using the Epila cream are given below.Before using the Epila cream, you should inform the doctorAbout your complete medical history. Especially if you are suffering from the problems such as cuts on the skin, skin infections, and sores on the face.If you are taking any other prescription at the same time as the product may interact with those medicines. Also, if you are taking any herbal products, then inform the doctor about them.If you are suffering from allergic reactions, then avoid using these prescriptions. Also, if you have allergic problems with the ingredients used in this medicine, then you should from the doctor.Epila cream is prescribed to patients having age younger than twelve years.This medicine is not used to remove hair from other parts of the body.Avoid touching the cream to the eyes, mouth, and nose.Epila cream in pregnancy should be used with the consultation of the doctor.
